resources.string: Roses are one of the most popular and well-known flowers in the world, with over 100 different species and thousands of cultivars available. They are native to Asia, Europe, and North America, and have been cultivated for thousands of years for their beauty, fragrance, and medicinal properties.

Tulips are a popular spring-blooming flower that are native to Central Asia and Turkey. They were introduced to Europe in the 16th century and quickly became popular, especially in the Netherlands, where they eventually became a symbol of Dutch culture and a major export.

Lilies are a popular flowering plant that is native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. They are known for their large, showy flowers and strong, sweet fragrance. There are many different species of lilies, including Asiatic, Oriental, and trumpet lilies, each with its own unique characteristics and colors.
